tit.e: Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi (Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun)
Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi (Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun)
Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi (Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun)

sen.j: 『日出処の天子』（ひいづるところのてんし）は山岸凉子による日本の漫画。
sen.e: Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi (Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun) is Japanese manga (cartoon or comics), written by Ryoko YAMAGISHI.
Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi (Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun) is Japanese manga (cartoon or comics), written by Ryoko YAMAGISHI.
Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi (Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun) is Japanese manga (cartoon or comics), written by Ryoko YAMAGISHI.

sen.j: 略称は「ずる天」・「ひず天」・「処天」。
sen.e: Abbreviated names of Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi are "zuruten", "hizuten", and "tokoroten".
Abbreviated names of Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi are "zuruten", "hizuten", and "tokoroten".
Abbreviated names of Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi are "zuruten", "hizuten", and "tokoroten".

sen.j: 「LaLa」（白泉社）において、1980年4月号から1984年2月号、1984年4月号から6月号まで連載された。
sen.e: Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi was serialized in "LaLa" (Hakusensha, Inc.) from April issue in 1980 to February issue in 1984, and from April issue to June issue in 1984.
Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi was serialized in "LaLa" (Hakusensha, Inc.) from April issue in 1980 to February issue in 1984, and from April issue to June issue in 1984.
Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi was serialized in "LaLa" (Hakusensha, Inc.) from April issue in 1980 to February issue in 1984, and from April issue to June issue in 1984.

sen.j: 厩戸王子（聖徳太子）と蘇我毛人（蘇我蝦夷）を中心に、主人公である厩戸王子が少年時代を経て、摂政になるまでを描く。
sen.e: Centering on Umayadono-Oji (Prince Umayado) (Prince Shotoku) and SOGA no Emishi, the main character, Prince Umayado' s life from his boyhood until he became Sessho (regent) was described in this manga..

Centering on Umayadono-Oji (Prince Umayado) (Prince Shotoku) and SOGA no Emishi, the main character, Prince Umayado' s life from his boyhood until he became Sessho (regent) was described in this manga..

Centering on Umayadono-Oji (Prince Umayado) (Prince Shotoku) and SOGA no Emishi, the main character, Prince Umayado' s life from his boyhood until he became Sessho (regent) was described in this manga..

sen.j: 聖と俗、男と女という矛盾を抱える厩戸王子の圧倒的な存在感に加え、厩戸王子を天才・超能力者・同性愛者として描く斬新さが特徴。
sen.e: In addition to the overwhelming presence of Prince Umayado who embraced the contradiction of sacred and secular and men and women, this manga is characterized by originality of the story; he was described as genius, telepathic, and homosexual.

In addition to the overwhelming presence of Prince Umayado who embraced the contradiction of sacred and secular and men and women, this manga is characterized by originality of the story; he was described as genius, telepathic, and homosexual.

In addition to the overwhelming presence of Prince Umayado who embraced the contradiction of sacred and secular and men and women, this manga is characterized by originality of the story; he was described as genius, telepathic, and homosexual.

sen.j: 厩戸王子には超能力を持っているとでもしなければ説明できないような逸話が『聖徳太子伝暦』などに残っており、これはこうした伝承・伝説を積極的に採用したものである。
sen.e: Concerning Prince Umayado, there are anecdotes, which can't be explained without the idea that Prince Umayado had supernatural power, written in historical documents such as "Shotokutaishi-Denryaku (biography of Shotokutaishi)", and these traditions and legends are positively adopted in this manga.

Concerning Prince Umayado, there are anecdotes, which can't be explained without the idea that Prince Umayado had supernatural power, written in historical documents such as "Shotokutaishi-Denryaku (biography of Shotokutaishi)", and these traditions and legends are positively adopted in this manga.

Concerning Prince Umayado, there are anecdotes, which can't be explained without the idea that Prince Umayado had supernatural power, written in historical documents such as "Shotokutaishi-Denryaku (biography of Shotokutaishi)", and these traditions and legends are positively adopted in this manga.

sen.j: 1983年度、第7回講談社漫画賞少女部門受賞。
sen.e: In the year 1983, "Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi " was awarded Girl's Comic Division of Kodansha Manga Sho (The Kodansha Manga Award).
In the year 1983, "Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi " was awarded Girl's Comic Division of Kodansha Manga Sho (The Kodansha Manga Award).
In the year 1983, "Hi Izuru Tokoro no Tenshi " was awarded Girl's Comic Division of Kodansha Manga Sho (The Kodansha Manga Award).

sen.j: 夏目房之介は「戦後マンガ史に残る傑作である」と評している。
sen.e: Fusanosuke NATSUME commented that "this is the great work of postwar manga history.
Fusanosuke NATSUME commented that "this is a great work in the postwar manga history".
sen.cmt: おかしい英語表現を訂正しました。閉じる"が抜けています。
sen.e: Fusanosuke NATSUME commented that "this is a great work in the postwar manga history".

sen.j: また不安定に変化する厩戸王子の表情に注目し、その変貌を「手塚治虫以来日本のマンガに脈うつ男女変身譚および異人変身譚の最大の収穫のひとつだろう」と語っている。
sen.e: Moreover, with focusing on the facial expression of Prince Umayado that changes unsteadily, he said that its changes "are one of the biggest fruit of the stories of transformation (man turns into woman and woman turn into man, or a person turns into a different person) that has been throbbing through Japanese manga since Osamu TEZUKA."
sen.cmt: ”男女変身譚および異人変身譚”が、よくわかりませんでした。
sen.e: Moreover, with focusing on the facial expression of Prince Umayado that changes unsteadily, he said that its changes "are one of the biggest fruit of the stories of transformation (man turns into woman and woman turn into man, or a person turns into a different person) that has been throbbing through Japanese manga since Osamu TEZUKA."

Moreover, with focusing on the facial expression of Prince Umayado that changes unsteadily, he said that its changes "are one of the biggest fruit of the stories of transformation (man turns into woman and woman turn into man, or a person turns into a different person) that has been throbbing through Japanese manga since Osamu TEZUKA."

sen.j: こういった表情は実に細かな描線で描かれており、薄い紙に模写したところで「1ミリの何分の1でも線が狂えば表情は変わってしまう」のだという。
sen.e: These facial expressions were drawn with very fine lines and it is said that when they are copied out on thin papers, "facial expression will be changed if you miss your aim in a fraction of 1mm."
These facial expressions were drawn with very fine lines and it is said that when they are copied out on thin papers, "facial expression will be changed if you miss your aim in a fraction of 1mm."
These facial expressions were drawn with very fine lines and it is said that when they are copied out on thin papers, "facial expression will be changed if you miss your aim in a fraction of 1mm."

sen.j: 本作は、飛鳥時代を背景に、政治的策謀をめぐらす厩戸王子に毛人（馬子の長子として描かれている）をはじめとする蘇我家の人々や、崇峻天皇・推古天皇らが翻弄される形で話が進んでいく。
sen.e: In this manga, against a backdrop of the Asuka period, the story develops in the form of that members of the Soga Family including Emishi (he was portrayed as a first child of Umako), Emperor Sushun and Empress Suiko were made fools of by Prince Umayado who figured out political scheme,

sen.j: 蘇我毛人はある日天女と見まごう美しい女童に出会い、ほのかな恋心を抱く。
sen.e: One day, SOGA no Emishi met a beautiful girl who just looked like a celestial nymph, and had a secret crush on her.
One day, SOGA no Emishi met a beautiful girl who just looked like a celestial nymph, and had a secret crush on her.
One day, SOGA no Emishi met a beautiful girl who just looked like a celestial nymph, and had a secret crush on her.

sen.j: それが厩戸王子との出会いであった。
sen.e: That was the encounter of Prince Umayado.
That was the encounter with Prince Umayado.
sen.cmt: 前置詞が間違っています。
sen.e: That was the encounter with Prince Umayado.

sen.j: 年若くとも並はずれた教養、政治的手腕、威厳を持つ厩戸は並み居る臣下からも一目置かれる存在となる。
sen.e: Prince Umayado who had extraordinary education, political competence and air of dignity in spite of his youth came to be a presence respected by a host of vassals.
Prince Umayado who had extraordinary education, political competence and air of dignity in spite of his youth came to be a presence respected by a host of vassals.
Prince Umayado who had extraordinary education, political competence and air of dignity in spite of his youth came to be a presence respected by a host of vassals.

sen.j: しかし厩戸は自らが持つ不思議な力ゆえに実母の穴穂部に疎まれていた。
sen.e: However, he got on the wrong side of his biological mother, Anahobe, because of strange power he had.
However, he got on the wrong side of his biological mother, Anahobe, because of strange power he had.
However, he got on the wrong side of his biological mother, Anahobe, because of strange power he had.

sen.j: 同じく厩戸の不思議を感知した毛人は、時折垣間見る厩戸の孤独に心を痛める。
sen.e: Emishi who also realized Umayado's strange power was troubled by Umayado's loneliness he sometimes saw.
Emishi who also realized Umayado's strange power was troubled by Umayado's loneliness he sometimes saw.
Emishi who also realized Umayado's strange power was troubled by Umayado's loneliness he sometimes saw.

sen.j: 尊敬と畏怖と好意を持って厩戸に接する毛人だが、厩戸にとって毛人は自分の持つ超能力を共有できる唯一の不可欠な存在であった。
sen.e: Emishi treated Umayado with respect, awe and a high regard, on the other hand, for Umayado, Emishi was the only and indispensable presence who could share the supernatural power Umayado had.
Emishi treated Umayado with respect, awe and a high regard, but, for Umayado, Emishi was the only and indispensable presence who could share the supernatural power Umayado had.
sen.cmt: 不適切な表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: Emishi treated Umayado with respect, awe and a high regard, but, for Umayado, Emishi was the only and indispensable presence who could share the supernatural power Umayado had.

sen.j: しかし毛人は無意識下でしか超能力を引き出せず、自分の能力を自覚していない。
sen.e: However, Emishi didn't realize his own supernatural power, because he only could bring out his power while he was unconscious.
However, Emishi did not recognize his own supernatural power, because he only could bring out his power while he was unconscious.
However, Emishi did not recognize his own supernatural power, because he only could bring out his power while he was unconscious.

sen.j: 厩戸の毛人への思いはやがて愛へと変わってゆき、毛人も自分が厩戸に惹かれていることを感じるが、やがて石上神宮の巫女であった布都姫と出会い、恋に落ちてしまう。
sen.e: Umayado's feelings for Emishi shortly turned into love and Emishi also realized that he was attracted to Umayado, however, before long, he met Futohime who was miko (a shrine maiden) of Isonokami-jingu Shrine and fell in love with her.

Umayado's feelings for Emishi shortly turned into love and Emishi also realized that he was attracted to Umayado, but before long, he met Futohime who was miko (a shrine maiden) of Isonokami-jingu Shrine and fell in love with her.

Umayado's feelings for Emishi shortly turned into love and Emishi also realized that he was attracted to Umayado, but before long, he met Futohime who was miko (a shrine maiden) of Isonokami-jingu Shrine and fell in love with her.

sen.j: 厩戸は嫉妬に悩まされ、策謀をめぐらして布都姫を退けようとするが、毛人に気づかれる。
sen.e: Umayado suffered from jealous and figured out schemes to shut Futohime away from Emishi, however Emishi realized that.
Umayado suffered from jealousy and figured out schemes to shut Futohime away from Emishi, however Emishi realized that.
Umayado suffered from jealousy and figured out schemes to shut Futohime away from Emishi, however Emishi realized that.

sen.j: いままでの諸事に厩戸の策略があったことを悟った毛人は、厩戸に二人が結べば万物を自由に動かす力が実現されこの世を意のままにできるから共に生きようと説得される
sen.e: Emishi who saw through Emayado's schemes was persuaded by Umayado to live together, because if they were united, they could get the power to control all nature freely and twist the world around their little fingers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Emishi who saw through Emayado's schemes was persuaded by Umayado to live together, because if they were united, they could get the power to control all nature freely and twist the world around their little fingers.

Emishi who saw through Emayado's schemes was persuaded by Umayado to live together, because if they were united, they could get the power to control all nature freely and twist the world around their little fingers.

sen.j: しかし、毛人は二人が共に男として生まれたのは一緒になってはいけない運命だからだと答え、苦渋のうちに厩戸から離れ、布都姫を選ぶ。
sen.e: However, Emishi answered that there was a fate that they must not be together this is why both were born as men, and left Umayado with pain and chose Futohime.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Emishi answered that it was a fate that they must not be together and this was why both were born as men, and left Umayado with painful reluctance and chose Futohime.
sen.cmt: andを追加し、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: However, Emishi answered that it was a fate that they must not be together and this was why both were born as men, and left Umayado with painful reluctance and chose Futohime.

sen.j: 作品は厩戸が孤独の中に残される一方、政治的実権を握り、遣隋使を発案するところで終わる。
sen.e: While Prince Umayado was left alone in loneliness, he took political power and this story ends at the scene where Umayado suggested a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.
While Prince Umayado was left alone in loneliness, he took political power and this story ended at the scene where Umayado suggested a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.
sen.cmt: 現在形を過去形に変更しました。
sen.e: While Prince Umayado was left alone in loneliness, he took political power and this story ended at the scene where Umayado suggested a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.

sen.e: The Characters

sen.j: 聖徳太子（うまやどのおうじ）
sen.e: Prince Shotoku (Prince Umayado)
Prince Shotoku (Prince Umayado)
Prince Shotoku (Prince Umayado)

sen.j: 本作の主人公。
sen.e: He is a main character of this manga.
He is a main character of this manga.
He is a main character of this manga.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』や『上宮聖徳法王帝説』などの史料に描かれた「聖徳太子」像とは全く異なる人物造形を施されている。
sen.e: In this story, Umayado was portrayed as completely different from the image of "Prince Shotoku" described in historical documents such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi).

In this story, Umayado was portrayed as completely different from the image of "Prince Shotoku" described in historical documents such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi).

In this story, Umayado was portrayed as completely different from the image of "Prince Shotoku" described in historical documents such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi).

sen.j: これについて作者は文庫版2巻に収録された氷室冴子との対談で、「聖徳太子にまつわるエピソードに子供の頃から違和感を持っており、ある時、居酒屋で矢代まさこを相手にそういう話をしていたら、梅原猛の『隠された十字架』を紹介され、翌日それを買ってきて読んで、その時に全てのイメージが出て来た」と語っている。
sen.e: Concerning this, in the interview with Saeko HIMURO which was written down in its second volume of paper back, the author said, "I've had an uncomfortable feeling about stories related to Prince Shotoku since childhood, and one day I talked about this to Masako YASHIRO at izakaya bar, then she introduced the book "Kakusareta jujika (hidden cross)" written by Takeshi UMEHARA to me, and next day, when I bought the book and read it, image of the story came to my head."

Concerning this, in an interview with Saeko HIMURO, which was written down in the second volume of paper back, the author said, "I've had an uncomfortable feeling about the stories related to Prince Shotoku since my childhood, and one day I talked about this to Masako YASHIRO at an izakaya bar, she introduced the book "Kakusareta jujika (hidden cross)" written by Takeshi UMEHARA to me, and when I bought the book and read it next day, the whole image of the story came to my head."

Concerning this, in an interview with Saeko HIMURO, which was written down in the second volume of paper back, the author said, "I've had an uncomfortable feeling about the stories related to Prince Shotoku since my childhood, and one day I talked about this to Masako YASHIRO at an izakaya bar, she introduced the book "Kakusareta jujika (hidden cross)" written by Takeshi UMEHARA to me, and when I bought the book and read it next day, the whole image of the story came to my head."

sen.j: 物語の主役は王子や毛人の子供たちに移り、かつて上宮王家と謳われた厩戸一族の滅亡を描く。

sen.e: The story begins with the sudden death of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.

sen.j: 刀自古と厩戸王子の子、山背大兄王子は、両親の葬儀に出席させるため、実父の厩戸によって生まれてから15年間軟禁されていた末妹、馬屋古女王を解放する。
sen.e: Tojiko and Prince Yamashiro no oe, a son of Prince Umayado, released their youngest sister, Umaya no himemiko who had been confined for fifteen years since she was born, in order to make her attend her parent's funeral.

Tojiko and Prince Yamashiro no oe, a son of Prince Umayado, released their youngest sister, Umaya no himemiko who had been confined for fifteen years since she was born, in order to make her attend her parent's funeral.

sen.j: 馬屋古は厩戸の子供たちで唯一、父に酷似した美しい容姿の持ち主であった。
sen.e: Umaya no himemiko was an only child of other Umayado's children who had a good looks precisely like her father.
Umaya no himemiko was an only child of other Umayado's children who had a good looks precisely like her father.

sen.j: しかし彼女が解放されてから上宮王家に不穏な兆しが見え始める。
sen.e: However, after her release, an ominous sign had started to be seen.

sen.j: 山背大兄とは幼少時から気心の知れた仲であるが、舂米を巡っての恋敵でもあった人物として描かれている。
sen.e: Although he and Prince Yamashiro no oe had been close friends since childhood, he is also portrayed as a rival in love over Tsukishime.
Although he and Prince Yamashiro no oe had been close friends since childhood, he is also portrayed as a rival in love over Tsukishime.
Although he and Prince Yamashiro no oe had been close friends since childhood, he is also portrayed as a rival in love over Tsukishime.

sen.j: 舂米女王（つきしねのひめみこ）
sen.e: Tsukishime no himemiko
Tsukishime no himemiko
Tsukishime no himemiko

sen.j: 厩戸と膳郎女の娘。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.
She was a daughter of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.
She was a daughter of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.

sen.j: 厩戸の血を実際に引いているのは、橘大郎女と膳郎女の生んだ子たちだけという設定で、彼女はこの夫婦の最初の子供である。
sen.e: In this story, children who were actually descended from Umayado were children of TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume and Kashiwadenominoiratsume only, and Tsukishime no himemiko was the first child of Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.

In this story, children who were actually descended from Umayado were children of TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume and Kashiwadenominoiratsume only, and Tsukishime no himemiko was the first child of Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.

In this story, children who were actually descended from Umayado were children of TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume and Kashiwadenominoiratsume only, and Tsukishime no himemiko was the first child of Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.

sen.j: 彼らの子の多くは何らかの知的障害を持って生まれたが、舂米と長谷は例外的に厩戸の優れた能力の一端を継承した人物として描かれている。
sen.e: Many of their children were born with some kind of intellectual disabilities, however, Tsukishime and Ohatsuse are portrayed as characters who exceptionally inherited a part of Umayado's impressive ability.

Many of their children were born with some kind of intellectual disabilities, but Tsukishime and Ohatsuse are portrayed as characters who exceptionally inherited a part of Umayado's impressive ability.

Many of their children were born with some kind of intellectual disabilities, but Tsukishime and Ohatsuse are portrayed as characters who exceptionally inherited a part of Umayado's impressive ability.

sen.j: 作中では山背の妻となっており、夫婦仲もむつまじかった。
sen.e: In the story, she became a wife of Prince Yamashiro no oe and they were compatible married couple.
In the story, she became a wife of Prince Yamashiro no oe and they were compatible married couple.
In the story, she became a wife of Prince Yamashiro no oe and they were compatible married couple.

sen.j: しかし、馬屋古の出現とともに夫婦仲にヒビが入り始める。
sen.e: However, with the appearance of Umaya no himemiko, a rift started to open up between them.
However, with the appearance of Umaya no himemiko, a rift started to open up between them.
However, with the appearance of Umaya no himemiko, a rift started to open up between them.

sen.j: 長谷王（はつせのおうじ）
sen.e: Ohatsuse no Oji
Ohatsuse no Oji
Ohatsuse no Oji

sen.j: 厩戸と膳郎女の息子。
sen.e: He was a son of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.
He was a son of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.
He was a son of Prince Umayado and Kashiwadenominoiratsume.

sen.j: 厩戸の弟の来目に似ている。
sen.e: He looked like Kume, a younger brother of Prince Umayado.
He looked like Kume, a younger brother of Prince Umayado.
He looked like Kume, a younger brother of Prince Umayado.

sen.j: 舂米と同じく優れた人物として評価されている。
sen.e: He was also regarded as a person of high caliber same as Tsukishime no himemiko.
He was also regarded as a person of high caliber same as Tsukishime no himemiko.
He was also regarded as a person of high caliber same as Tsukishime no himemiko.

sen.j: 作中では、同母妹である馬屋古に恋をして苦しむ。
sen.e: In this story, he fell in love with a younger sister-uterine, Umaya no himemiko and was tormented by love.
In this story, he fell in love with a younger sister-uterine, Umaya no himemiko and was tormented by love.
In this story, he fell in love with a younger sister-uterine, Umaya no himemiko and was tormented by love.

sen.j: 難波王（なにわのおおじ）
sen.e: Naniwa no Oji
Naniwa no Oji
Naniwa no Oji

sen.j: 佐富女王（さとみのひめみこ）
sen.e: Satomi no Himemiko
Satomi no Himemiko
Satomi no Himemiko

sen.j: 厩戸の異父妹。
sen.e: She was a younger maternal half-sister.
She was a younger maternal half-sister.
She was a younger maternal half-sister.

sen.j: 父は厩戸の異母兄である田目王子。
sen.e: Her father was Prince Tame, Umayado's older paternal half-brother.
Her father was Prince Tame, Umayado's older paternal half-brother.
Her father was Prince Tame, Umayado's older paternal half-brother.

sen.j: 優れた卜部（占い者）であり、容姿は母・間人媛によく似ている。
sen.e: She was an excellent urabe (diviner) and she resembled her mother, Hashihito no Himemiko closely.
She was an excellent urabe (diviner) and she resembled her mother, Hashihito no Himemiko closely.
She was an excellent urabe (diviner) and she resembled her mother, Hashihito no Himemiko closely.

sen.j: 厩戸に疎まれていた。
sen.e: She had gotten on the wrong side of Umayado.
She had gotten on the wrong side of Umayado.
She had gotten on the wrong side of Umayado.

sen.j: 毎日新聞捏造報道事件
sen.e: Mainichi shimbun netsuzo hodo jiken (Incident of fabricated report by Mainichi Shimbun)
Mainichi shimbun netsuzo hodo jiken (Incident of fabricated report by Mainichi Shimbun)
Mainichi shimbun netsuzo hodo jiken (Incident of fabricated report by Mainichi Shimbun)

sen.j: 1984年1月24日付けの毎日新聞全国版社会面に本作品に対して「え、これが聖徳太子!?」「法隆寺カンカン」などという見出しで法隆寺が遺憾に思っている、という記事が掲載されたが、これはすべて奈良支局の記者による捏造記事であった。
sen.e: In the January 24, 1984 issue of the social section of whole nation edition of Mainichi Shinbun, the article which said Horyu-ji Temple deplored this manga under the headline of "Oh my god! Is this really Prince Shotoku" and "Horyu-ji Temple got steamed up" appeared, however, this was all a fabricated report by a press person of Nara branch.
sen.cmt: 全国版社会面の定訳不明
sen.e: In the January 24, 1984 issue of the the local news page of the whole nation edition of Mainichi Shinbun, the article which said Horyu-ji Temple deplored this manga under the headline of "Oh my god! Is this really Prince Shotoku" and "Horyu-ji Temple got steamed up" appeared, but this was a fabricated report by a press person of the Nara branch.

In the January 24, 1984 issue of the the local news page of the whole nation edition of Mainichi Shinbun, the article which said Horyu-ji Temple deplored this manga under the headline of "Oh my god! Is this really Prince Shotoku" and "Horyu-ji Temple got steamed up" appeared, but this was a fabricated report by a press person of the Nara branch.

sen.j: 同年2月4日版紙面にて謝罪文が掲載された。
sen.e: In the February 4th issue in the same year, the written apology was printed on paper.
In the February 4th issue in the same year, a written apology was printed on paper.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を変更しました。
sen.e: In the February 4th issue in the same year, a written apology was printed on paper.
